protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
description: This protocol is a continuation of the previous protocol (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.m4yc8xw) for viral metagenomic researches with the tissues of Molluscs, such as abalone, oyster, clam,  scallop and so on. This maybe also applicable for other animals, such as shrimp and fish, based on the principle of the protocol. But we havn't verified this idea yet.
protocol_affiliation: Key Laboratory of Aquatic Product Processing, Ministry of Agriculture, South China Sea Fisheries Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Fishery Sciences
manuscript_citation:
Please cite this article when you are publishing your study which refered to this protocol.

Wei, HY., Huang, S., Wang, JY. et al. Genes Genom (2017). https://doi.org/10.1007/s13258-017-0629-1

source_data.protocol_name: Isolation of Viral Like Particles (VLP) from Tissues of Molluscs
source_data.protocol_name_html: Isolation of Viral Like Particles (VLP) from Tissues of Molluscs
source_data.description: This is a protocol especielly for the isolation of Viral Like Particles (VLP) from the tissues of Molluscs, such as abalone, oyster, clam,  scallop and so on. This maybe also applicable for other animal tissues, such as shrimp and fish, based on the principle of the protocol. But we havn't verified this idea yet.
source_data.protocol_affiliation: Key Laboratory of Aquatic Product Processing, Ministry of Agriculture, South China Sea Fisheries Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Fishery Sciences
source_data.manuscript_citation: Please cite this article when you are publishing your study which refered to this protocol.

components.data: Tissue samples are sliced off and freezed in liquid Nitrogen instantly. Then transfer to -80℃ freezer after return to laboratory.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Tissue samples are sliced off and freezed in liquid Nitrogen instantly. Then transfer to -80℃ freezer after return to laboratory.

source_data.annotation: Visceral mass and gills are the best target tissues for isolation, as viruses are easily concentrated in those organs.

source_data.annotation: We have tested with from minimum 20 mg of oyster spat samples to maximum 20 g of abalone samples for VLP isolation. And we all acquired certain amount of Viral reads after seqenced by Illunima platform.
source_data.thread_text: We have tested with from minimum 20 mg of oyster spat samples to maximum 20 g of abalone samples for VLP isolation. And we all acquired certain amount of Viral reads after seqenced by Illunima platform.
source_data.body: We have tested with from minimum 20 mg of oyster spat samples to maximum 20 g of abalone samples for VLP isolation. And we all acquired certain amount of Viral reads after seqenced by Illunima platform.

components.data: Add about 1 to 1.5 times volume of SB (Stabilizing Buffer, 0.2 M NaCl, 50 mM Tris-HCl, 5 mM CaCl2, and 5 mM MgCl2, pH 7.5) and grind with grinding machine at 4℃.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add about 1 to 1.5 times volume of SB (Stabilizing Buffer, 0.2 M NaCl, 50 mM Tris-HCl, 5 mM CaCl2, and 5 mM MgCl2, pH 7.5) and grind with grinding machine at 4℃.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Isolation of Viral Like Particles (VLP) from Tissues of Molluscs
source_data.annotation: For example, adding 1-1.5 mL SB buffer to homogenize 1g tissues
source_data.thread_text: For example, adding 1-1.5 mL SB buffer to homogenize 1g tissues
source_data.body: For example, adding 1-1.5 mL SB buffer to homogenize 1g tissues

components.data: Add extra SB to fix a final volume at 3-5 times of weightened tissue, and make it fully homogenized.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add extra SB to fix a final volume at 3-5 times of weightened tissue, and make it fully homogenized.

components.data: Add extra SB to fix a final volume at 5-10 times of weightened tissue, if you want to maximize the dissolution of VLP from cell debris.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add extra SB to fix a final volume at 5-10 times of weightened tissue, if you want to maximize the dissolution of VLP from cell debris.

components.data: Supernatants then filtrated with Millex-HV 0.45 μm and 0.22 μm filters (Merck Millipore, Billerica, MA, USA) sequentially
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Supernatants then filtrated with Millex-HV 0.45 μm and 0.22 μm filters (Merck Millipore, Billerica, MA, USA) sequentially

components.data: Sucrose cushion (sucrose-SB solution, 28% w/w) was added to the bottom of the ultracentrifuge tube first.

source_data.description: Sucrose cushion (sucrose-SB solution, 28% w/w) was added to the bottom of the ultracentrifuge tube first.

components.data: Conduct differential centrifugation at 4 °C, sequentially from 1,000 3,000 5,000 8,000 10,000 g, each time for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation: Use liquid nitrogen and 50℃ water bath to proceed the cycle. But it needs to be removed immediately after melting in the water bath.
source_data.thread_text: Use liquid nitrogen and 50℃ water bath to proceed the cycle. But it needs to be removed immediately after melting in the water bath.
source_data.body: Use liquid nitrogen and 50℃ water bath to proceed the cycle. But it needs to be removed immediately after melting in the water bath.

components.data: Add the appropriate amount of DNase solution （820 μl ddH2O, 90 μl 10× DNase I Buffer, 90 μl DNase I (1 U/μl)） to the tube, and use pipette tip to fully suspend precipitation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the appropriate amount of DNase solution （820 μl ddH2O, 90 μl 10× DNase I Buffer, 90 μl DNase I (1 U/μl)） to the tube, and use pipette tip to fully suspend precipitation.

components.data: Transfer supernatants (step 7) into ultracentrifuge tubes, softly laying onto 28% (w/w) sucrose cushion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer supernatants (step 7) into ultracentrifuge tubes, softly laying onto 28% (w/w) sucrose cushion.

source_data.body: Operation with carefulness, as 28% sucrose solution is easily disturbed

components.data: Incubating at 37 °C for 60 min in shaker at 150 rpm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubating at 37 °C for 60 min in shaker at 150 rpm.

components.data: Centrifuging at 10000 g for 5 min and then transferr supernatant to a new tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of untitled protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ The kit HP Viral DNA/RNA Kit is not indispensable. You can replace it with any brand of kits, such as QIAamp cador Pathogen Mini Kit (Qiagen), as long as it suitable for extraction both viral DNA and RNA from liquid samples.

♣ The entire procedure MUST BE RNase free
source_data.thread_text:
♠ The kit HP Viral DNA/RNA Kit is not indispensable. You can replace it with any brand of kits, such as QIAamp cador Pathogen Mini Kit (Qiagen), as long as it suitable for extraction both viral DNA and RNA from liquid samples.

♣ The entire procedure MUST BE RNase free
source_data.body:
♠ The kit HP Viral DNA/RNA Kit is not indispensable. You can replace it with any brand of kits, such as QIAamp cador Pathogen Mini Kit (Qiagen), as long as it suitable for extraction both viral DNA and RNA from liquid samples.

♣ The entire procedure MUST BE RNase free

components.data: Follow the kit protocol, then you will acquire 15-50 μl of viral DNA/RNA solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Follow the kit protocol, then you will acquire 15-50 μl of viral DNA/RNA solution.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 2 of untitled protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation: DO NOT add carrier RNA, as carrier RNA will account  a high percentage in the dataset from high throughput seqencing.
source_data.thread_text: DO NOT add carrier RNA, as carrier RNA will account  a high percentage in the dataset from high throughput seqencing.
source_data.body: DO NOT add carrier RNA, as carrier RNA will account  a high percentage in the dataset from high throughput seqencing.

components.data: Use Qubit™ (Thermo Fisher) and Qubit™ dsDNA HS Assay Kit (Thermo Fisher) to specifically quantify the concentration of dsDNA. If the amount is high that means previous extraction is successful.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Use Qubit™ (Thermo Fisher) and Qubit™ dsDNA HS Assay Kit (Thermo Fisher) to specifically quantify the concentration of dsDNA. If the amount is high that means previous extraction is successful.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of untitled protocol
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation: If you like, you can also use Qubit™ RNA HS Assay Kit to specifically quantify RNA. But we don't recommand Qubit™ ssDNA Assay Kit, as it is not specific.
source_data.thread_text: If you like, you can also use Qubit™ RNA HS Assay Kit to specifically quantify RNA. But we don't recommand Qubit™ ssDNA Assay Kit, as it is not specific.
source_data.body: If you like, you can also use Qubit™ RNA HS Assay Kit to specifically quantify RNA. But we don't recommand Qubit™ ssDNA Assay Kit, as it is not specific.

components.data: Now, we are ready to use REPLI-g® Cell WGA & WTA Kit (Qiagen) to amplify both viral DNA RNA, or only viral RNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Now, we are ready to use REPLI-g® Cell WGA & WTA Kit (Qiagen) to amplify both viral DNA RNA, or only viral RNA.

cases.title: WGA&WTA
cases.label: both viral DNA and RNA amplification

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ We havn't fully assessed the performances of three amplification strategies. 

♣ However, we found that the production of WTA is usually than WTA&WGA protocol. Sometime, the barren production of WTA will even not be qualified to the further library construction.

♥ And the differences in terms of viral diversity with three strategies are still under assessment.

♦ We just use half of the required volume of kit protocol to save some money.

◊ DO READ THROUGH the whole REPLI-g Cell WGA & WTA Handbook
source_data.thread_text:
♠ We havn't fully assessed the performances of three amplification strategies. 

♣ However, we found that the production of WTA is usually than WTA&WGA protocol. Sometime, the barren production of WTA will even not be qualified to the further library construction.

♥ And the differences in terms of viral diversity with three strategies are still under assessment.

♦ We just use half of the required volume of kit protocol to save some money.

◊ DO READ THROUGH the whole REPLI-g Cell WGA & WTA Handbook
source_data.body:
♠ We havn't fully assessed the performances of three amplification strategies. 

♣ However, we found that the production of WTA is usually than WTA&WGA protocol. Sometime, the barren production of WTA will even not be qualified to the further library construction.

♥ And the differences in terms of viral diversity with three strategies are still under assessment.

♦ We just use half of the required volume of kit protocol to save some money.

◊ DO READ THROUGH the whole REPLI-g Cell WGA & WTA Handbook

components.data:
Preparing Quantiscript RT mix (Table 1): 

 

Table 1. Quantiscript RT mix

Component

Volume/reaction

RT/Polymerase Buffer

2 μl

gDNA Wipeout Buffer

1 μl

H2O sc

0.5 μl

Random Primer

0.5 μl

Oligo dT Primer

0.5 μl

Quantiscript RT Enzyme Mix

0.5 μl

Total volume

5 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Table 1. Quantiscript RT mix

Component

Volume/reaction

2 μl

gDNA Wipeout Buffer

1 μl

H2O sc

0.5 μl

Random Primer

0.5 μl

Oligo dT Primer

0.5 μl

Quantiscript RT Enzyme Mix

0.5 μl

Total volume

5 μl

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.
source_data.thread_text:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.
source_data.body:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.

components.data: Add 5 μl RT mix to the aliquot (5 μl) in step 6. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.

0.5 μl

Total volume

15 μl

source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ If not being used directly, store the amplified DNA at –15 ºC to –30ºC until required for downstream applications.

♣ We recommend storage of the amplified DNA at a concentration of at least 100 ng/μl.
source_data.thread_text:
♠ If not being used directly, store the amplified DNA at –15 ºC to –30ºC until required for downstream applications.

♣ We recommend storage of the amplified DNA at a concentration of at least 100 ng/μl.

♣ We recommend storage of the amplified DNA at a concentration of at least 100 ng/μl.

components.data: Add Fully mixed 0.6 × volume of AMPure Beads (Beckman Coulter) to the solution from above step. Mix by gently pipetting entire volume up and down 10 times
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 19 of Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ Take out AMPure Beads from refrigerator to sit in RT for at least 15 min.

♣ Make sure AMPure Beads is full mixed before use, this will ensure the purification effect.
source_data.thread_text:
♠ Take out AMPure Beads from refrigerator to sit in RT for at least 15 min.

♣ Make sure AMPure Beads is full mixed before use, this will ensure the purification effect.
source_data.body:
♠ Take out AMPure Beads from refrigerator to sit in RT for at least 15 min.

♣ Make sure AMPure Beads is full mixed before use, this will ensure the purification effect.

components.data: Incubate at RT for 15 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at RT for 15 min.

components.data: Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate beads from supernatant. After the solution is clear (about 5 minutes), carefully remove and discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate beads from supernatant. After the solution is clear (about 5 minutes), carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 21 of Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution: do not discard beads).
source_data.thread_text: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution: do not discard beads).
source_data.body: Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets (Caution: do not discard beads).

components.data: Add 200-600 μl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200-600 μl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol to the tube while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant.

components.data: Repeat above Step to do the ethanol clean again.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat above Step to do the ethanol clean again.

components.data: Put the tube back in the magnetic stand,completely remove the residual ethanol, and air dry beads for 10 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with lid open.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Put the tube back in the magnetic stand,completely remove the residual ethanol, and air dry beads for 10 minutes while the tube is on the magnetic stand with lid open.

components.data: Elute the DNA target from the beads with 15 μl nuclease-free water. Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down, and put the tube in the magnetic stand until the solution is clear.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Elute the DNA target from the beads with 15 μl nuclease-free water. Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down, and put the tube in the magnetic stand until the solution is clear.

components.data: Transfer the supernatant to a clean PCR tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer the supernatant to a clean PCR tube.

components.data: We recommend using the transposase base library construction strategy. These kit convert the complex steps of DNA fragment, end repair and adaptor connection into a one-step enzymatic reaction, which significantly reduce the demanded amount of the initial DNA and shorten the time of library construction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: We recommend using the transposase base library construction strategy. These kit convert the complex steps of DNA fragment, end repair and adaptor connection into a one-step enzymatic reaction, which significantly reduce the demanded amount of the initial DNA and shorten the time of library construction.

source_data.reagent_name: NEBNext® Ultra™ II FS DNA Library Prep Kit
TruePrep DNA Library Prep Kit V2 for Illumina
TruePrep Index Kit V# for Illumina
NEBNext Singleplex or Multiplex Oligos for Illumina

source_data.description: Incubate at 24°C for 5 min.

components.data: Add 1 μl gDNA Wipeout Buffer the lysed sample. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 μl gDNA Wipeout Buffer the lysed sample. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
Incubate at 42°C for 10 min.

components.data:
Prepare Quantiscript RT mix (Table 1).

 

Table 1. Quantiscript RT mix

Component

Volume/reaction

RT/Polymerase Buffer

2 μl

H2O sc

0.5 μl

Random Primer

0.5 μl

Oligo dT Primer

0.5 μl

Quantiscript RT Enzyme Mix

0.5 μl

Total volume

4 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare Quantiscript RT mix (Table 1).

 

Table 1. Quantiscript RT mix

Component

Volume/reaction

RT/Polymerase Buffer

2 μl

H2O sc

0.5 μl

Random Primer

0.5 μl

Oligo dT Primer

0.5 μl

Quantiscript RT Enzyme Mix

0.5 μl

Total volume

4 μl

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 9 of Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Nucleic Acid Extraction, Amplification and Library Construction for Viral Metagenomic Sequencing.
source_data.annotation:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.
source_data.thread_text:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.
source_data.body:
♠ gDNA Wipeout buffer will be deactivate in this Mix. So the DNA is kept during RT reaction.

♣ The using of both random and oligo dT Primers will improve the proformance of RT reaction.

♥ NOTE: The Quantiscript RT mix must be prepared fresh.

components.data: Add 4 μl RT mix to the aliquot (6 μl) in step 8. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 4 μl RT mix to the aliquot (6 μl) in step 8. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
Incubate at 42°C for 60 min

components.data: Stop the reaction by incubating at 95ºC for 3 min, then cool on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop the reaction by incubating at 95ºC for 3 min, then cool on ice.

components.data:
Prepare the ligation mix (Table 2).

 

Table 2 Ligation mix

Component

Volume/reaction

Ligase Buffer

4 μl

Ligase Mix

1 μl

Total volume

5 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

Table 2 Ligation mix

Component

Volume/reaction

Ligase Buffer

4 μl

Ligase Mix

1 μl

5 μl

source_data.annotation:
IMPORTANT: When preparing the ligation mix, add the components in the order shown in Table 2. 

NOTE: The ligation mix must be prepared fresh.
source_data.thread_text:

NOTE: The ligation mix must be prepared fresh.

IMPORTANT: When preparing the ligation mix, add the components in the order shown in Table 2.

components.data: Add 5 μl ligation mix to the WTA ready reaction (10 μl) from step 12. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 μl ligation mix to the WTA ready reaction (10 μl) from step 12. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
Incubate at 24°C for 30 min.

components.data: Stop the reaction by incubating at 95°C for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop the reaction by incubating at 95°C for 5 min.

components.data:
Prepare REPLI-g SensiPhi amplification mix (Table 3).

 

Table 3 Preparing REPLI-g Sensiphi amplification mix

Component

Volume/reaction

REPLI-g sc Reaction Buffer

14.5 μl

REPLI-g Sensiphi DNA Polymerase

0.5 μl

Total volume

15 μl
components.name: Description

source_data.body: NOTE: The REPLI-g SensiPhi amplification mix must be prepared fresh.

components.data: Add 15 μl REPLI-g SensiPhi amplification mix to the ligation reaction (15 μl) from step 16. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 15 μl REPLI-g SensiPhi amplification mix to the ligation reaction (15 μl) from step 16. Mix by vortexing and centrifuge briefly.
Incubate at 30°C for 2h.

components.data: Stop the reaction by incubating at 65°C for 5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stop the reaction by incubating at 65°C for 5 min.

source_data.annotation:
♠ If not being used directly, store the amplified DNA at –15 ºC to –30ºC until required for downstream applications.

♣ We recommend storage of the amplified DNA at a concentration of at least 100 ng/μl.
